title: Authors and Citation
text: Rashid U (2024). rchiro: Collection R Functions Statistical Analysis Chiropractic Clinical Studies. R package version 0.0.1, https://gallvp.github.io/rchiro.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rchiro: Collection of R Functions for Statistical Analysis of Chiropractic Clinical Studies},   author = {Usman Rashid},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://gallvp.github.io/rchiro}, }

what: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
text: function checks element data frame determine NaN (Number). returns logical matrix element TRUE corresponding element data frame NaN, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
text: x data frame checked NaN values.

title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
text: logical matrix dimensions input data frame, TRUE indicating NaN values FALSE indicating non-NaN values.

title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
code: df <- data.frame(a = c(1, NaN, 3), b = c(NaN, 2, NaN)) is.nan(df) #>          a     b #> [1,] FALSE  TRUE #> [2,]  TRUE FALSE #> [3,] FALSE  TRUE

what: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
text: function calculates standardized beta coefficients fitted linear mixed-effects model (using lmer function lme4 package). Standardized beta coefficients obtained scaling fixed effects coefficients standard deviations predictor variables outcome variable.

title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
text: mod fitted linear mixed-effects model object class lmerMod, typically created lmer function lme4 package.

title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
text: vector standardized beta coefficients corresponding fixed effects (excluding intercept) model.

title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
code: library(lme4) #> Loading required package: Matrix # Fit a linear mixed-effects model mod <- lmer(Reaction ~ Days + (Days | Subject), sleepstudy) # Calculate standardized beta coefficients lmer.std.beta(mod) #>      Days  #> 0.5352302

what: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
text: function formats p-value standardized number significant digits. p-value smaller threshold (10^(-sigD)), returned "<0.001" (another appropriate threshold based sigD), otherwise, rounded specified number significant digits.

title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
text: value numeric value representing p-value formatted. sigD integer specifying number significant digits retain. Default 3.

title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
text: function takes p-value checks smaller certain threshold determined sigD parameter. p-value smaller threshold, returns string indicating value smaller threshold. Otherwise, p-value returned rounded specified number significant digits.

title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
